Expedia's ratings reflect a mix of credit strengths and concerns coupled with a reasonably conservative balance sheet. The company has significant exposure to economic cyclicality and its impact on travel demand which is countered by strong secular growth trends as an increasing mix of travel reservations are made through OTAs (online travel agents). column4: Does Murdoch's paywall reversal signal a sale of The Times?
column5: Rupert Murdoch conceded defeat this week in his battle with Google and the Internet  an adversary even more powerful than the British government. Murdoch  uniquely among the world's media magnates  decided two years ago to create a "paywall" for the London Times that could not be penetrated by Google and other "parasitic" search engines. In effect  the paper was cut off completely from the public Internet. As one of Murdoch's newspaper managers later described this strategy: "Rupert

column4: Trial suggests Prevnar may also protect ages 18-49
column5: Pfizer Inc said a late-stage trial of its vaccine to protect against pneumococcal bacteria suggested it would also work in adults aged 18-49  thereby possibly expanding its sales.

column4: UPDATE 2-Trial suggests Prevnar may also protect ages 18-49
column5: Oct 4 Pfizer Inc said a late-stage trial of its vaccine to protect against pneumococcal bacteria suggested it would also work in adults aged 18-49  thereby possibly expanding its sales.

column4: Pfizer's Prevenar 13 vaccine meets trial goal
column5: Oct 4 Pfizer Inc said a late-stage study of its Prevenar 13 vaccine met the main trial goal  and the data will help to expand a European regulatory application for the vaccine.

column4: UPDATE 1-POSCO interested in Thyssen Americas unit - report
column5: * MoneyToday newspaper says POSCO submits letter of intent

column4: POSCO submits letter of intent for Thyssen's Steel Americas - report
column5: SEOUL  Oct 4 South Korean steelmaker POSCO  has submitted a letter of intent to buy ThyssenKrupp AG's Steel Americas  a media report said on Thursday.

column4: Rio bets it can become Brazil's Silicon Beach
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO For years  Rio de Janeiro's bohemian neighborhood of Lapa has been a hotspot for people seeking samba shows and late night partying. But recently  the area has also started hosting a different kind of crowd.

column4: FEATURE-Rio bets it can become Brazil's Silicon Beach
column5: * Rio's lifestyle charms seen as an asset to recruit talent

column4: Global issuers flock to dim sum bonds  repatriation of funds a worry - RBS
column5: HONG KONG  Oct 4 Strong growth in the offshore yuan bond market is luring more global issuers to tap the nascent market  yet Beijing's tight grip over the repatriation of proceeds to mainland China remains a key concern  Royal Bank of Scotland said on Thursday.

column4: McGinley would be a great Ryder captain: Pistorius
column5: ST ANDREWS  Scotland 'Blade runner' Oscar Pistorius backed Paul McGinley's claims to take over as Europe's Ryder Cup captain after playing alongside the Irishman in the first round of the Dunhill Links pro-am on Thursday.

column4: INTERVIEW-Golf-McGinley would be a great Ryder captain - Pistorius
column5: ST ANDREWS  Scotland  Oct 4 'Blade runner' Oscar Pistorius backed Paul McGinley's claims to take over as Europe's Ryder Cup captain after playing alongside the Irishman in the first round of the Dunhill Links pro-am on Thursday.

column4: Oracle's CFO says no acquisitions needed to compete in cloud
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 4 Oracle Corp has all the pieces it needs to compete in cloud computing but is always interested in looking at compelling M&A opportunities  Chief Financial Officer Safra Catz told investors.

column4: RPT-UPDATE 3-Seadrill looks to move from Norway  CEO quits
column5: OSLO  Oct 3 Shipping tycoon John Fredriksen announced on Wednesday plans to move management at Seadrill  out of Norway  prompting the chief executive of the world's biggest deepsea drilling rig owner to leave and opening a new chapter in Fredriksen's controversial love-hate relationship with his former homeland.

column4: Romney  Obama both like deficit-cutting plan  to a point
column5: WASHINGTON President Barack Obama and Republican challenger Mitt Romney praised the deficit-cutting framework known as Simpson-Bowles in their debate on Wednesday  but neither candidate has embraced the politically unpopular choices put forward in the plan.

column4: RPT-Romney  Obama both like Simpson-Bowles plan  to a point
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 4 Republican hopeful Mitt Romney and President Barack Obama praised the deficit-cutting plan known as Simpson-Bowles at their debate on Wednesday  but neither has made the politically painful choices put forward by that scheme.

column4: Romney  Obama both like Simpson-Bowles plan  to a point
column5: WASHINGTON Republican hopeful Mitt Romney and President Barack Obama praised the deficit-cutting plan known as Simpson-Bowles at their debate on Wednesday  but neither has made the politically painful choices put forward by that scheme.

column4: Analysis: Is Sony buying time - or problems?
column5: TOKYO Sony Corp CEO Kazuo Hirai has spent $1.8 billion in the past three months snapping up an assortment of businesses such as medical equipment and cloud gaming  leaving investors to worry he is blowing his firm's waning finances on a muddled plan to revive the fading giant.

column4: Sprint weighs rival bid for MetroPCS: sources
column5: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel Corp  is considering making a rival bid for MetroPCS Communications Inc   which agreed on Wednesday to a merger with Deutsche Telekom AG's  T-Mobile USA  according to people familiar with the situation.

column4: UPDATE 3-Sprint weighs rival bid for MetroPCS -sources
column5: * Sprint may wait until after T-Mobile/MetroPCS deal -source

column4: Sprint weighs rival bid for MetroPCS-sources
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 4 Sprint Nextel Corp is weighing a potential rival bid for MetroPCS Communications Inc   which agreed on Wednesday to a merger with Deutsche Telekom AG's T-Mobile USA  according to sources familiar with the situation.

column4: Sprint considering counter bid for MetroPCS: report
column5: Sprint Nextel Corp  is in the early stages of considering a counter-offer for MetroPCS Communications Inc  to top Deutsche Telekom AG's  bid to combine it with T-Mobile USA  Bloomberg reported  citing sources.

column4: Sprint considering counter bid for MetroPCS - report
column5: Oct 4 Sprint Nextel Corp is in the early stages of considering a counter-offer for MetroPCS Communications Inc to top Deutsche Telekom AG's  bid to combine it with T-Mobile USA  Bloomberg reported  citing sources.

column4: State Street  Bank of NY Mellon submit living wills to Fed
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 4 State Street Corporation  and Bank of New York Mellon Corp have submitted living wills to banking regulators  the Federal Reserve announced on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Statoil say gas output reduced further
column5: OSLO  Oct 4 Statoil's gas production on the Norwegian continental shelf was reduced by another 19 million cubic metres (mcm) per day due to unplanned outage  the company said on Thursday.

column4: Statoil's Snorre A platform resumes after overnight shutdown
column5: OSLO  Oct 4 Production on Statoil's  Snorre A platform was up and running after a late Wednesday gas alarm triggered a shutdown  a Statoil spokesman said on Thursday.

column4: Statoil say gas output reduced by 8 mcm/day for one day
column5: OSLO  Oct 4 Statoil's gas production on the Norwegian continental shelf was reduced by 8 million cubic metres per day due to an unplanned outage  the company said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Statoil to partially restart Snorre A platform
column5: OSLO  Oct 4 Statoil was partially restarting production on its Snorre A oil and gas platform in the Norwegian North Sea on Thursday morning after gas alarms overnight shut the facility  a company spokeswoman said.

column4: Statoil's Snorre platform shut after alarm  undergoing restart
column5: OSLO  Oct 4 Statoil's Snorre A oil and gas platform in the Norwegian North Sea was shut overnight after a gas alarm and the facility was undergoing a partial restart on Thursday morning  a company spokeswoman said.

column4: Charles Schwab and TD Ameritrade closing businesses in Europe
column5: LONDON Charles Schwab  and TD Ameritrade   two large United States-based trading firms  are shutting down some of their European businesses  marking the latest casualties of a slow trading year in the region.

column4: Toyota China sales in Sept halved from August - paper
column5: TOKYO  Oct 5 Toyota Motor Corp's sales in China last month halved from levels in August as anti-Japanese sentiment took its toll  the Yomiuri newspaper reported on Friday  citing the Japanese automaker.

column4: Toyota says illegal strike at S.Africa plant over
column5: CAPE TOWN  Oct 4 Toyota said on Thursday an illegal three-day strike at its South African manufacturing plant in the port city of Durban had ended with production expected to resume on Friday.

column4: Illegal strike hits Toyota in South Africa
column5: CAPE TOWN An illegal strike has halted production at Toyota Motor Corp's  manufacturing plant in the South African city of Durban for the last three days  a company official said on Thursday.

column4: Illegal strike hits Toyota in South Africa
column5: CAPE TOWN  Oct 4 An illegal strike has halted production at Toyota Motor Corp's manufacturing plant in the South African city of Durban for the last three days  a company official said on Thursday.

column4: Companies see Alaska LNG project cost at up to $65 bln
column5: Oct 4 Oil companies putting together plans for a new "megaproject" to ship liquefied natural gas abroad from Alaska estimated the cost will run between $45 billion and $65 billion  according to a letter sent to the state governor  Sean Parnell.

column4: Unilever mulls possible $400 mln Skippy peanut butter sale
column5: LONDON  Oct 4 Consumer goods group Unilever Plc/NV  is looking at a possible sale of its Skippy peanut butter business based in the United States and Canada which could  if sold  fetch around $400 million.

column4: Cisco boosts virtual networking with vCider acquisition
column5: Networking equipment company Cisco Systems Inc  said on Thursday it has acquired virtual networking company vCider to defend itself from competitors in the cloud computing business.

column4: Cisco boosts virtual networking with vCider acquisition
column5: Oct 4 Networking equipment company Cisco Systems Inc said on Thursday it has acquired virtual networking company vCider to defend itself from competitors in the cloud computing business.

column4: Walmart says union's LA protest has no impact
column5: LOS ANGELES/CHICAGO Walmart employees affiliated with a union-backed group walked off the job in Los Angeles on Thursday  protesting conditions at the world's largest retailer  which promptly defended itself  saying the "publicity stunt" was not having an impact on its business.

column4: UPDATE 1-MOVES-Wells Fargo shifts management in wealth group
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 4 Wells Fargo & Co has transferred Jim Hays  a veteran wealth management executive who had run its large brokerage network  to oversee a smaller group of brokers at the bank's branches.
